member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.Core.RazorPageExtensions
member.summary: Adds ImageUltimate related extensions methods to class for ASP.NET Core support.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.Core.RazorPageExtensions.ImageTag(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPageBase,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask})
member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
member.returns: The image element.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for changing this library's configuration for web use.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location to store cached images. The default value is "~/App_Data/ImageCache". The location can be a plain physical/virtual path string or a instance for one of the supported file systems like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob. When you use a cache path within the current application's root directory (e.g. "~/SomeFolder", "/SomeFolder" or "C:\inetpub\wwwroot\MySite\SomeFolder"), the request will be handled directly via IIS (using RewritePath) for better download performance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheMaxAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum amount of time to consider a cached item fresh and keep it stored in the cache. Cached items older than this age will be removed when the cache trimming (clean up) runs (when auto trim is run or when Trim method is manually called). The default value is 90 days. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheWaitTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum amount of time to wait for a cached item to be available (wait for a file lock from other threads or processes to become available, i.e. wait for an ongoing caching of the same file to complete) before giving up on the cache request. The default value is 5 minutes. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheAutoTrimInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the interval to run automatic cache trimming (clean up). Cached items older than will be removed when the cache is trimmed. If the value is 0 or negative, the auto trim is disabled. The default value is 20 minutes. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.GetCache
member.summary: Gets the image cache used by this web configuration instance.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.SourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the default source path for finding images. The default value is "~/App_Data/ImageSource". Value can be a virtual or physical path, however always returns a physical path, ie. if the original value was a virtual path, returns the resolved physical path. Whenever a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is passed to a image loading/processing method, it will be considered relative to this source path. If the path passed to the method is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), this source path will be ignored for that method call.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.RewritePathEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether RewritePath should be enabled. The default is true. When you use a cache path within the current application's root directory (e.g. "~/SomeFolder", "/SomeFolder" or "C:\inetpub\wwwroot\MySite\SomeFolder"), the request will be handled directly via IIS (using RewritePath) for better download performance. If you set this property to false, then the internal download handler will be forced so that byte-range requests are supported.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.ImageHandlerPath
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the application-relative handler path for . The default is "image.ashx".
It is not recommended to change it unless you have a conflict in your web application. This property will be effective only if it is changed before web application starts.

member.summary: Initializes only the static Current instance.

member.summary: Gets current global configuration instance.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask
member.summary: Provides methods for processing a source image in a chained manner for web use and caching the resulting image. This class can not be instantiated, it's passed as a parameter to your lambda expression so that you can chain image processing commands.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask.Format(GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebSafeFormat)
member.summary: Overrides the file format for the resulting image. By default the same file format of the source image will be used and if that format is not supported for saving, then Jpeg format will be used.
member.param: The web-safe file format used to save the image.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask.FileName(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the file name (excluding extension) of the resulting image in the generated url (usually for SEO purposes). By default the same name of the source image will be used. Note that the file extension is appended automatically according to the current save format.
member.param: The file name (excluding extension) to use in the generated url.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This is a sub-namespace of this library for web use, it extends the core namespace to support ASP.NET and handles caching.
The main classes in this namespace are:
is the class for processing an image file under ASP.NET.
is the class for changing this library's configuration for web use (e.g. setting cache location for images).

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace
member.summary: Defines the color spaces of images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Undefined
member.summary: Undefined color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.CMY
member.summary: CMYK without black separation.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.CMYK
member.summary: CMYK is a subtractive color model used in color printing. CMYK refers to the four inks used in color printing: cyan, magenta, yellow, and key (black).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Gray
member.summary: Grayscale, also known as black-and-white, is a color model composed exclusively of shades of gray, varying from black at the weakest intensity to white at the strongest.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HCL
member.summary: HCL (Hue, Chroma, Luminance)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HCLp
member.summary: HCLp is a modification of HCL to try to match Photoshop.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSB
member.summary: HSB (Hue, Saturation, Brightness)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSI
member.summary: HSL (Hue, Saturation, Intensity)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSL
member.summary: HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness/Luminance)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSV
member.summary: HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HWB
member.summary: HWB (Hue, Whiteness, Blackness)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Lab
member.summary: Lab is a three-dimensional color model, where the L stands for the lightness of the color, the “a” is the redness vs. greenness, while the “b” is the yellowness vs. blueness.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCH
member.summary: LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCHab
member.summary: LCHab is cylindrical transformation of the CIELAB color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCHuv
member.summary: LCHuv is cylindrical transformation of the CIELUV color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Log
member.summary: Log (short for logarithmic), you can think of log as a color space “archiver” (in the same way zip or rar does it for files).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LMS
member.summary: LMS ((long, medium, short), a perceptual color space based on the response functions of the cones in the retina of the eye. It is mostly used in psychophysical research.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Luv
member.summary: A modification of "CIE 1931 XYZ" to display color differences more conveniently. The CIELUV space is especially useful for additive mixtures of lights, due to its linear addition properties.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.OHTA
member.summary: Object segmentation using OHTA colour space is one of successful methods to separate fruit object and background.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Rec601YCbCr
member.summary: ITU-R Recommendation BT.601, more commonly known by the abbreviations Rec. 601 or BT.601 (or its former name, CCIR 601) is a standard originally issued in 1982 by the CCIR.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Rec709YCbCr
member.summary: ITU-R Recommendation BT.709, more commonly known by the abbreviations Rec. 709 or BT.709, standardizes the format of high-definition television, having 16:9 (widescreen) aspect ratio.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.RGB
member.summary: RGB is an additive color model in which red, green, and blue light are added together in various ways to reproduce a broad array of colors.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.scRGB
member.summary: scRGB is a wide color gamut RGB (Red Green Blue) color space created by Microsoft and HP that uses the same color primaries and white/black points as the sRGB color space but allows coordinates below zero and greater than one.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.sRGB
member.summary: The sRGB color space, or standard RGB (Red Green Blue), is an RGB color space created cooperatively by Hewlett-Packard and Microsoft Corporation for use on the Internet.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Transparent
member.summary: Transparent color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.XyY
member.summary: The XyY color space is a transformation of the CIE XYZ color space onto 2 dimensions.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.XYZ
member.summary: XYZ (aka "CIE 1931") is the first attempt to produce a color space based on measurements of human color perception and the basis for almost all other color spaces.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YCbCr
member.summary: YCbCr, used widely in video and image compression schemes such as MPEG and JPEG.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YCC
member.summary: YCC is an extension of YCbCr that extends the color gamut beyond the R/G/B primaries specified by BT.709.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YDbDr
member.summary: The YDbDr scheme used by SECAM television is rotated in another way.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YIQ
member.summary: YIQ was formerly used in NTSC (North America, Japan and elsewhere) television broadcasts for historical reasons.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YPbPr
member.summary: YPbPr is a scaled version of YUV. It is most commonly seen in its digital form.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YUV
member.summary: The Y′UV model defines a color space in terms of one luma (Y′) and two chrominance (UV) components. The Y′UV color model is used in the PAL composite color video (excluding PAL-N) standard.
